page.title: 11Dean Castle Country Park
page.content:
Dean Castle Country Park belongs to the people of Kilmarnock. It covers 200 acres and is made up of woods and fields. The North is bordered by farmland, while the rest is enclosed by housing estates.
Wildlife _ rabbits,foxes,red squirrel,rats,mice,voles,badgers,roe deer,owls,hawks,kestrels,trout,minnows etc. abundant due to a variety of habitats (coniferous woods, deciduous woods, meadows,river and pond).
The Country Park Centre in the Dower House provides information, lecture room,displays,tea-room,first-aid equipment and toilets. Rangers patrol and guide visiting groups. There is close liaison with local schools.
